<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_FdSet_ConvertIn_Impl:
```c
static int32 OS_FdSet_ConvertIn_Impl(int *os_maxfd, fd_set *os_set, const OS_FdSet *OSAL_set)
{
    size_t       offset;
    size_t       bit;
    osal_index_t id;
    uint8        objids;
    int          osfd;
    int32        status;

    status = OS_SUCCESS;
    for (offset = 0; offset < sizeof(OSAL_set->object_ids); ++offset)
    {
        objids = OSAL_set->object_ids[offset];
        bit    = 0;
        while (objids != 0)
        {
            id = OSAL_INDEX_C((offset * 8) + bit);
            if ((objids & 0x01) != 0 && id < OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES)
            {
                osfd = OS_impl_filehandle_table[id].fd;
                if (osfd >= 0)
                {
                    if (osfd >= FD_SETSIZE || !OS_impl_filehandle_table[id].selectable)
                    {
                        /* out of range of select() implementation */
                        status = OS_ERR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED;
                    }
                    else
                    {
                        FD_SET(osfd, os_set);
                        if (osfd > *os_maxfd)
                        {
                            *os_maxfd = osfd;
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
            ++bit;
            objids >>= 1;
        }
    }

    return status;
}
```
